meta.title: COVID-19 - Unionville-Chadds Ford School District

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasFooter fsHasOneColumnLayout fsSection2038 fsHasTheme2

div.p: UCFSD | Empower each student to succeed in life and contribute to society

input.name: q
input.title: search
input.style: width: 100%; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: -0.0625em 0px 0px; height: 1.25em; outline: none;

div.div: UNLOCKING THE POTENTIAL IN ALL OF USWe believe that the district runs at its best when all members of the community are working at their best. This vision is core to who we are and our approach to engagement with all stakeholders in this community.
QUALITY SERVICEUCFSD hires and retains the best educators who are supported by the region's finest in-house support staff - all of whom are committed to student success and service excellence.
Visit BoardDocsBoardDocs is an online portal to all UCFSD Board information including: agendas, minutes, videos, recaps, policies, calendars, member bios, contacts and more...

li.a: View Board Videos and Access Live Streaming Here

input.name: q
input.title: search
input.style: width: 100%; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: -0.0625em 0px 0px; height: 1.25em; outline: none;

li.a: Bus Stop Safety Guidelines for Students
View Board Videos and Access Live Streaming Here

div.p: The Unionville-Chadds Ford School District will continue to evaluate things as we follow the spread of COVID-19 in PA and our neighboring states. Our custodial teams continue to engage in heightened cleaning practices, cleaning and disinfecting frequently touched objects and surfaces. Teachers are encouraging students to wash their hands regularly and cover their mouths when they sneeze and cough. We encourage students, staff, and families to follow the same practices that help prevent the spread of the flu and other illnesses. The health and safety of our students, staff, and the greater community is a priority.

Please stay tuned for regular updates as we continue to monitor and reassess the current situation daily. This page provides updates from the District, resources from national, state-level and county-level health agencies, tips to help reduce the risk in homes and the UCF community and more.
Thank you for your continued support in our efforts to keep everyone safe.

a.data-page-name: Frequently Asked Questions about the Impact of COVID-19 on UCFSD

div.class: fsDiv fsStyleTwoThirds fsStyleColumn fsStyleColumn-2 fsStyleColumn-last fsStyleAutoclear

div.h2: Current Phase of District Action Plan
div.p: On April 9, 2020, Governor Tom Wolf announced that all K-12 Pennsylvania schools will remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-20 academic year continuing his efforts to protect the health and safety of students and communities during the COVID-19 pandemic.

We are in Phase 3 of our Pandemic Action Plan. District buildings and campuses are closed for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year, and during this time students and staff are participating in distance learning. Spring Break will continue as planned (April 6th through April 13th). April 14th will be an in-service day for teachers - this will be a day off for students. Students will return to distance learning on April 15th and continue with distance learning through the end of the school .

We will continue to monitor the situation and inform you of any changes.
Please see the UCFSD Pandemic Phase Level Action Plan below for details of each phase level.
You can also download the Phase Level Action Plan here.

li.a: See the UCF COVID-19 Phase Level Action Plan Here

h2.a: See the UCF COVID-19 Phase Level Action Plan Here

p.strong: Supplemental Links for UCF Action Plan:

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window

div.p: All UCFSD school buildings and campuses will remain closed throughout the remainder of the 2019-20 school year, following Governor Wolf's announcement on April 9, 2020, closing all K-12 Pennsylvania schools in an effort to protect the health and safety of students and communities during the COVID-19 pandemic.

p.a: Please click here for the latest information regarding the COVID-19 pandemic.
